title: Tesla Shareholders Approve $1T Pay Package for Musk with Milestones
snippets: Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for Elon Musk that could allow him to earn an unprecedented one trillion dollars' worth of stock.
Live updates: Tesla shareholders approve Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package Reuters
The richest man in the world will get hundreds of millions of new shares if he hits his targets.
Shareholders approved the pay package with as much as 75 percent support on Thursday.
The massive pay package could make Musk the world's first trillionaire, but the Tesla CEO needs to hit a series of ambitious milestones over the next decade.

Tesla shareholders awarded CEO Elon Musk a pay package on Wednesday that could grant the tech entrepreneur nearly $1 trillion in compensation over the next decade.
Tesla shareholders approved CEO Elon Musk's historic pay package at the company's annual shareholders meeting in Austin, Texas.

Tesla shareholders voted Thursday to approve Elon Musk’s staggering new pay package, in a move aimed at retaining the controversial CEO’s leadership during a time of great upheaval for the automaker. Over 75 percent of shares voted in favor of the proposal. The vote gives Musk enormous sway over his
The CEO will have to meet a series of goals to earn the rewards, including raising Tesla’s market capitalization to $8.5 trillion.
The proposal received more than 75% approval. Musk can earn the $1 trillion in shares over the next 10 years if Tesla hits a number of milestones.

summary: Tesla shareholders have overwhelmingly approved a historic pay package for CEO Elon Musk that could potentially grant him $1 trillion in stock over the next decade, provided he meets ambitious performance milestones, including raising Tesla's market capitalization to $8.5 trillion. The approval, with over 75% of votes in favor, occurred at the company's annual meeting in Austin, Texas. This package, aiming to retain Musk's leadership, could make him the world's first trillionaire if all conditions are met.

title: Judge Orders Full SNAP Funding for 42M Amid Shutdown
snippets: Trump administration must fully fund food aid benefits by Friday, US judge rules Reuters
The federal judge ruled that Trump was choosing to withhold federal food aid due to "political reasons".
Judge orders White House to pay full SNAP benefits by Friday Axios
A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to make a payment to fully fund SNAP for the month of November by tomorrow.
The Trump administration recently said it would not pay any SNAP benefits, but then offered partial funding of the food stamp program after a judge's ruling.

Ruling comes in response to a challenge to administration’s offer to only partly fund US food benefits amid shutdown A federal judge in Rhode Island ordered the Trump administration on Thursday to find the money to fully fund food stamps for 42 million low-income Americans in November by Friday, in
In a Thursday ruling, a Rhode Island federal judge called on the Trump administration to provide food stamps during the government shutdown.

summary: A Rhode Island federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to fully fund the SNAP food aid program for 42 million low-income Americans by Friday, following an initial decision to withhold or partially fund the benefits for November due to political reasons. This ruling comes amid a government shutdown and challenges the administration's actions regarding food assistance.

This decision overrides a lower court ruling that mandated the inclusion of male, female, and X markers on passports.

title: GTA VI Launch Delayed to November 2026 for Game Polishing

Grand Theft Auto VI is being delayed again: it will now launch on November 19th, 2026. “We are sorry for adding additional time to what we realize has been a long wait, but these extra months will allow us to finish the game with the level of polish you have come to expect and deserve,” […]

summary: Grand Theft Auto VI, initially scheduled for a 2025 release, has been delayed multiple times. Originally set to launch in May of the following year, its release date has now been pushed back to November 19, 2026. Rockstar Games cites the need for additional time to polish the game to meet fans' expectations as the reason for the delay.

summary: Former NFL player Antonio Brown has been extradited from Dubai to the U.S. to face an attempted murder charge. The charge is related to a May incident in Miami, where it's alleged Brown fired shots after a fight at a celebrity boxing event, with one bullet reportedly grazing a victim's neck. Brown was arrested in Dubai on a warrant issued in June and is now in Miami for trial.

title: Trump Secures Deal to Cut Costs for Key Diabetes, Obesity Drugs
snippets: Medicare beneficiaries will soon be able to get obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs for a $50 copay. But there are some limitations.
US President Donald Trump announces agreements with drug makers Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk.
Weight loss drug brands Ozempic, Wegovy and Mounjaro have risen sharply in popularity in the US, but they are still considered unaffordable.

summary: US President Donald Trump announced agreements with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk to lower costs for obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs, including popular brands Ozempic, Wegovy, and Mounjaro. Medicare beneficiaries will be able to access these medications for a $50 copay, despite their rising popularity and previously high costs. The deal aims to expand coverage and make these drugs more affordable.

title: Ex-DOJ Employee Acquitted in Subway Sandwich Assault Case
snippets: The acquittal on a misdemeanor charge comes after the case came to represent broader resistance in the nation's capital to the Trump administration's law enforcement surge.

Dunn's not guilty verdict concludes the case.

Hundreds of police officers were deployed to manage the situation in the residential area. A teenage boy was among those arrested, and Independent MP Ayoub Khan participated in the pro-Palestine demonstration.

President Sheinbaum presses charges after groping incident in Mexico street Axios
A video of a man touching Mexico’s first female president, Claudia Sheinbaum, shocked many Mexicans but did not surprise them. “It’s so common,” one woman said.
titles: Mexico President Sheinbaum presses charges after street groping incident - AP News
President Sheinbaum presses charges after groping incident in Mexico street - Axios
Mexico’s President Presses Charges Against Man Who Groped Her on the Street
summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has filed charges against a man who was caught on video groping her near the presidential palace. This action highlights the ongoing issue of women's safety in Mexico and sends a strong message against harassment.

title: Google, Amazon Reforestation Deal Marks Symbiosis Coalition's First Pick
snippets: Exclusive: Google deal makes Amazon reforestation its top source of carbon removal credits Reuters
The deal is the first selected by the Symbiosis Coalition, an advance market commitment founded to seed the market for nature-based carbon removal.
titles: Exclusive: Google deal makes Amazon reforestation its top source of carbon removal credits - Reuters
Google to buy carbon credits from massive Amazonian reforestation project
summary: Google has entered into a deal prioritizing Amazon reforestation as its main source of carbon removal credits. This agreement is the inaugural selection by the Symbiosis Coalition, a group established to encourage the market for nature-based carbon removal solutions.

title: Study Suggests Universe Expansion Slowing, Challenges Dark Energy Theory
snippets: Evidence now suggests the universe’s expansion has started to slow, not speed up. The findings imply dark energy is weakening, marking a possible revolution in cosmology.

It is widely accepted that the universe is expanding at an accelerating rate, but now researchers say our measurements of the mysterious force driving that may be wrong and that the universe began to slow 1.5 billion years ago – yet other scientists disagree
titles: The Universe may have already started slowing down
Is the expansion of the universe slowing down?
summary: Recent research suggests the universe's expansion may be slowing, challenging the widely accepted view of acceleration due to dark energy. This implies dark energy could be weakening, a potential revolution in cosmology. The study indicates this slowdown started 1.5 billion years ago, although some scientists dispute these findings.

title: NASA Study Finds Aging Stars May Devour Close Planets; Rogue Planet Observed
snippets: Astronomers have discovered that aging stars may be devouring their closest giant planets as they swell into red giants. Using NASA’s TESS telescope to study nearly half a million stars, scientists found far fewer close-orbiting planets around older, expanded stars—clear evidence that many have alre
The James Webb and Very Large telescopes spotted a free-floating planet accreting material at a record rate, displaying behavior similar to how stars form. Scientists aren't clear as to why.
titles: Astronomers discover dying stars eating their planets
Astronomers discover bizarre 'runaway' planet that's acting like a star, eating 6 billion tons per second
summary: Astronomers, using NASA's TESS telescope, observed that aging stars expand into red giants and likely consume their nearest giant planets, evidenced by the scarcity of close-orbiting planets around older stars. Additionally, the James Webb and Very Large telescopes detected a free-floating planet accreting material at a record pace, a process usually seen in star formation, though the reason remains unclear.

title: Tesla to Launch Cybercabs, Credits Waymo; Musk Hints at Reveal Date Flexibility
snippets: Musk said he picked the date so he "could say I was just kidding" if it changes again. He had spent months teasing a reveal by the end of this year.
Elon Musk said he expects Tesla to be able to put all the Cybercabs it builds on the road, and thanked Waymo for "paving the path."
titles: Tesla delays reveal of production Roadster 2 to April Fools’ Day
Tesla to begin Cybercab production in April, Musk claims
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla plans to have all its Cybercabs operational, crediting Waymo for their pioneering efforts. Musk humorously noted the chosen reveal date allows for flexibility, following months of hints about a year-end reveal.

title: Newly Identified MINA Syndrome Linked to Movement Issues; Hope for Dementia Trea
snippets: A newly identified disorder, MINA syndrome, results from a mutation in the NAMPT protein that deprives motor neurons of energy, leading to severe movement problems. The discovery not only deepens understanding of nerve cell metabolism but also points toward potential therapies.

Weill Cornell researchers uncovered how free radicals from astrocyte mitochondria can fuel dementia. Using new compounds that target these radicals at their source, they slowed brain inflammation and neuronal damage in mice. The findings reveal a potential breakthrough for treating diseases like Alz
titles: Scientists just found a hidden genetic flaw that slowly steals strength
Scientists find hidden brain source that fuels dementia
summary: Researchers have identified MINA syndrome, a disorder caused by a mutation in the NAMPT protein, leading to severe movement issues by depriving motor neurons of energy. Additionally, Weill Cornell scientists discovered that targeting free radicals from astrocyte mitochondria with new compounds can slow brain inflammation and damage in mice, offering hope for treating dementia and similar diseases. These findings offer potential new pathways for therapy in neurological conditions.
